description.narrative:
This Project is to support the Northern Center for Planning & Investigation of Marine Resources-Environment (CPIM) of the Vietnam Administration of Seas and Islands (VASI), in cooperation with the General Department of Geology and Minerals of Vietnam (GDGMV), both under Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE). The Geological Survey of Denmark and Greenland (GEUS) is engaged to coordinate and provide support to project activities when Danish expertise is required.
Among others, the main results of the DV-WIND project will be: • VASI/CPIM and GDGMV scientists trained in the applicability of methods and tools used for establishing a reliable seabed zonation and assessment • An initial seabed zonation and de-risking of the Case Study area • Strengthened co-operation between VASI/CPIM, GDGMV and Danish counterpart organisations • Enhanced awareness within VASI/CPIM and GDGMV for the importance and value of their scientific contributions to the de-risking of offshore windfarm development • Strengthened profile of MONRE and increased awareness among stakeholders about the Ministry’s important role during the entire process for offshore windfarm development • Roadmap for VASI/CPIM and GDGMV future involvement in zonal seabed assessment

To contribute to sustainable energy development in Vietnam through strengthening capacity of relevant agencies under Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, enabling them to play a more effective role in the process of offshore windfarm development

mailing-address.narrative: Embassy of Denmark, 7th Floor, BIDV Tower, 194 Tran Quang Khai Street
